verbose_text: In this study, both the expression of PPARdelta and miR-9 were higher in pro inflammatory M1 than in anti-inflammatory M2 macrophages, indicating the potential involvement of PPARdelta and miR-9 in modulating the M1 macrophage phenotype.
evidence: M2 macrophages, indicating the potential involvement of PPARdelta and miR-9 in modulating the M1
